page.title: 02Biography: E.Holden of Olton
page.content: In Kineton Green Road, just off the Warwick Road in Olton is Gowan Bank, the home of Edith Holden. Edith Holden wrote Â£The Diary of An Edwardian Lady'. In the past few years, this book has become very popular and sold many hardback copies and was also made into a television series. Edith Holden wrote her diaries from 1906 to 1911, the 1906 diary being made into the book. Edith, the daughter of a Birmingham businessman, spent much of her spare time doing embroidery or painting. She was also very interested in nature and the diary is largely about the plants and creatures that she saw on her many walks into the countryside. Her illustrations bring the text alive and are a major reason for the success of the diary. Gowan Bank is now part of the Olton Conservation Area.
